New Records: Jazz Chisholm Jr became only the second player since 1900 to both hit a grand slam and steal three bases in their Saturday night win over the Atlanta Braves
Key Match Events: Chisholm stole his first base of the evening during the bottom of the fifth inning
Chisholm stole his second and third bases against lefty AJ Minter in the bottom of the seventh
Chisholm launched a grand slam against Michael Tonkin to put the game out of reach
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chisholm is the first player to pull off the accomplishment in 21 years
The only other player to hit a Grand Slam and steal three bases since 1900 is former All-Star outfielder Mike Cameron
Jake Burger also hit a go-ahead two-run homer on the night for the Marlins
Luis Arraez and Yuli Gurriel went deep to help them become the first NL East team to win a series against the division champions
